description:
Client for interacting with the Google Stackdriver Monitoring API (V3)_. Example 
    >>> from gcloud import monitoring
    >>> client = monitoring.Client()
    >>> query = client.query(minutes=5)
    >>> print(query.as_dataframe())  # Requires pandas.
At present, the client supports querying of time series, metric descriptors, and monitored resource descriptors. .. _Google Stackdriver Monitoring API (V3): https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/v3/

params.description: The ID of the group.
params.name: group_id

params.description: The metric type name.
params.name: metric_type

params.description: The resource type name.
params.name: resource_type

params.description: Remaining positional arguments to pass to constructor.
params.name: args

params.description: Remaining keyword arguments to pass to constructor.
params.name: kwargs

params.description: The path to a private key file (this file was given to you when you created the service account). This file must contain a JSON object with a private key and other credentials information (downloaded from the Google APIs console).
params.name: json_credentials_path

params.description: Remaining positional arguments to pass to constructor.
params.name: args

params.description: Remaining keyword arguments to pass to constructor.
params.name: kwargs

params.description: The e-mail attached to the service account.
params.name: client_email

params.description: The path to a private key file (this file was given to you when you created the service account). This file must be in P12 format.
params.name: private_key_path

params.description: The filter string used to determine which monitored resources belong to this group.
params.name: filter_string

params.description: The ID of the group's parent, if it has one.
params.name: parent_id

params.description: A user-assigned name for this group, used only for display purposes.
params.name: display_name

params.description: The ID of the group.
params.name: group_id

params.description: If true, the members of this group are considered to be a cluster. The system can perform additional analysis on groups that are clusters.
params.name: is_cluster

examples.code:
for group in client.list_groups():
    print((group.display_name, group.name))

params.description: An optional filter expression describing the metric descriptors to be returned. See the filter documentation_.
params.name: filter_string

params.description: An optional prefix constraining the selected metric types. This adds metric.type = starts_with("<prefix>") to the filter.
params.name: type_prefix

params.description: An optional filter expression describing the resource descriptors to be returned. See the filter documentation_.
params.name: filter_string

examples.code:
descriptor = client.metric_descriptor(
    'custom.googleapis.com/my_metric',
    metric_kind=MetricKind.GAUGE,
    value_type=ValueType.DOUBLE,
    description='This is a simple example of a custom metric.')
descriptor.create()
label = LabelDescriptor('response_code', LabelValueType.INT64,
                        description='HTTP status code')
descriptor = client.metric_descriptor(
    'custom.googleapis.com/my_app/response_count',
    metric_kind=MetricKind.CUMULATIVE,
    value_type=ValueType.INT64,
    labels=[label],
    description='Cumulative count of HTTP responses.')
descriptor.create()

params.description: An optional unit in which the metric value is reported.
params.name: unit

params.description: An optional detailed description of the metric.
params.name: description

params.description: An optional concise name for the metric.
params.name: display_name

params.description: The kind of measurement. It must be one of
params.name: metric_kind

params.description: A sequence of zero or more label descriptors specifying the labels used to identify a specific instance of this metric.
params.name: labels

params.description: The value type of the metric. It must be one of
params.name: value_type

params.description: The metric type including a DNS name prefix. For example: "custom.googleapis.com/my_metric"
params.name: type_

params.description: The number of days in the time interval.
params.name: days

params.description: The number of hours in the time interval.
params.name: hours

params.description: The number of minutes in the time interval.
params.name: minutes

params.description: The end time (inclusive) of the time interval for which results should be returned, as a datetime object. The default is the start of the current minute. The start time (exclusive) is determined by combining the values of days, hours, and minutes, and subtracting the resulting duration from the end time. It is also allowed to omit the end time and duration here, in which case
params.name: end_time

params.description: The metric type name. The default value is
params.name: metric_type

name: Client
